member.summary: Initialize is called once per request to contextualize this instance with appropriate state.
member.param: The original options passed by the application control behavior
The utility object to observe the current request and response
The logging factory used to create loggers

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationHandler`1.FinishResponseAsync
member.summary: Hook that is called when the response about to be sent

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationHandler`1.TeardownAsync
member.summary: Called once after Invoke by AuthenticationMiddleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationHandler`1.HandleRequestAsync
member.summary: Called once by common code after initialization. If an authentication middleware responds directly to specifically known paths it must override this virtual, compare the request path to it's known paths, provide any response information as appropriate, and true to stop further processing.
member.returns: Returning false will cause the common code to call the next middleware in line. Returning true will cause the common code to begin the async completion journey without calling the rest of the middleware pipeline.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationHandler`1.HandleUnauthorizedAsync(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.Features.Authentication.ChallengeContext)
member.summary: Override this method to deal with 401 challenge concerns, if an authentication scheme in question deals an authentication interaction as part of it's request flow. (like adding a response header, or changing the 401 result to 302 of a login page or external sign-in location.)
member.returns: True if no other handlers should be called

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Base Options for all authentication middleware

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationOptions.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: The AuthenticationScheme in the options corresponds to the logical name for a particular authentication scheme. A different value may be assigned in order to use the same authentication middleware type more than once in a pipeline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationOptions.AutomaticAuthenticate
member.summary: If true the authentication middleware alter the request user coming in. If false the authentication middleware will only provide identity when explicitly indicated by the AuthenticationScheme.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationOptions.AutomaticChallenge
member.summary: If true the authentication middleware should handle automatic challenge. If false the authentication middleware will only alter responses when explicitly indicated by the AuthenticationScheme.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationOptions.ClaimsIssuer
member.summary: Gets or sets the issuer that should be used for any claims that are created

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationOptions.Description
member.summary: Additional information about the authentication type which is made available to the application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationTicket
member.summary: Contains user identity information as well as additional authentication state.

member.param: the that represents the authenticated user.
additional properties that can be consumed by the user or runtime.
the authentication middleware that was responsible for this ticket.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions.BackchannelTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets timeout value in milliseconds for back channel communications with Twitter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions.BackchannelHttpHandler
member.summary: The HttpMessageHandler used to communicate with Twitter. This cannot be set at the same time as BackchannelCertificateValidator unless the value can be downcast to a WebRequestHandler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions.CallbackPath
member.summary: The request path within the application's base path where the user-agent will be returned. The middleware will process this request when it arrives.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions.SignInScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication scheme corresponding to the middleware responsible of persisting user's identity after a successful authentication. This value typically corresponds to a cookie middleware registered in the Startup class. When omitted, is used as a fallback value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions.DisplayName
member.summary: Get or sets the text that the user can display on a sign in user interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions.SaveTokensAsClaims
member.summary: Defines whether access and refresh tokens should be stored in the after a successful authentication. This property is set to false by default to reduce the size of the final authentication cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.SharedAuthenticationOptions.SignInScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication scheme corresponding to the default middleware responsible of persisting user's identity after a successful authentication. This value typically corresponds to a cookie middleware registered in the Startup class.

member.summary: Provides access to the normal system clock.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.SystemClock.UtcNow
member.summary: Retrieves the current system time in UTC.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.BaseControlContext.HandleResponse
member.summary: Discontinue all processing for this request and return to the client. The caller is responsible for generating the full response. Set the to trigger SignIn.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.BaseControlContext.SkipToNextMiddleware
member.summary: Discontinue processing the request in the current middleware and pass control to the next one. SignIn will not be called.

member.summary: Discontinue processing the request in the current middleware and pass control to the next one.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.EventResultState.HandledResponse

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CryptEncodeObject(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CERT_PUBLIC_KEY_INFO@,System.Byte[],System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Encodes a structure of the type indicated by the value of the lpszStructType parameter.
member.param: Type of encoding used.

The high-order word is zero, the low-order word specifies the integer identifier for the type of the specified structure so we can use the constants in http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa378145%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
A pointer to the structure to be encoded.
A pointer to a buffer to receive the encoded structure. This parameter can be NULL to retrieve the size of this information for memory allocation purposes.
A pointer to a DWORD variable that contains the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pbEncoded parameter.
